intro: Tapinostemma venustum, commonly known as the golden thorn, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed species, and is characterized by its woody stems and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds covered in a sticky, resinous substance. It is adapted to survive in dry conditions, with deep roots and a slow growth rate. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
